item.title: Using plots as ticks in PyPlot
item.description: Why? I was building a heatmap showing some result on different signal sources. The signals where different simple curves: sinus, triangle, square and saw-tooth waves. Now for annotating the plot, yes you could write down the names of the signals on the axis and yes that’s probably the ‘correct’ way to do it. But it is ugly and not intuitive if you could also just show the signals: How?
